title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live on Wednesday 31 May 2017 - BBC News
summary: son jailed for stabbing father to death .
man appears in court over murder of derby woman .
police hunt 'wrong way ' quad bike gang .
ilkeston fc face winding up order .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 .

documents.title: son jailed for stabbing father to death
text: son jailed for stabbing father to death

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from us for today .
we 'll be back with more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: modern slavery arrests in nottingham
text: two people have been arrested after a raid in hyson green as part of an investigation into modern slavery .
a 42-year-old man and a 39-year-old woman were arrested on sus of human trafficking and fraud by false representation and are being questioned .
a 57-year-old man who was found at a property in birkin avenue is being given support from nottinghamshire police , the force said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: security at nottingham open reviewed after manchester attacks
text: organisers of next month 's nottingham open have confirmed they have reviewed security arrangements at the tournament following last monday 's attacks in manchester .

a statement on the tournament 's website said : `` in light of recent events , we will again be reviewing our security measures in conjunction with the relevant authorities to ensure that they remain at an appropriate level .
`` during the tournament , we would ask everyone arriving to the nottingham tennis centre to allow enough time for security checks . ''
the aegon open runs between 10-18 june at the nottingham tennis centre .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your views : boyzone to perform in derby
text: the `` haters '' are out in force on our facebook page after boyzone announced plans to perform at derbyshire county cricket club in september .
karen o'donnell said : `` thanks for the warning i shall steer clear of the area . ''
simon vickers posted : `` bit ambitious , could play in a backroom of a pub and still have plenty of room i think . ''
steven edwards added : `` i 'm not exactly bowled over by this prospect . ''
boyzone fans head here to defend your boyz
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: exhibition charts history of 'europe 's largest railway sidings '
text: an exhibition of photographs has opened at erewash museum looking at the history of toton railway sidings in nottinghamshire .
the sidings , which were at one point the largest in europe , are set to become home for the east midlands hs2 hub .
the collection of images , which charts the history of the sidings between 1856-1984 , is open to the public until mid july .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingman jailed for stabbing father to death
text: a man has been jailed for a minimum of 20 years for murdering his father at their home in derby .
geoff seggie was found dead at the house in marylebone crescent , mackworth , on 1 december .
police said he had suffered multiple stab wounds .
daniel seggie , 31 , admitted murder earlier this month and was today given a life sentence at nottingham crown court .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: women sought over 1996 photographer sex claims
text: police in derbyshire are trying to re-establish contact with women who reported inappropriate behaviour by a photographer in 1996 .
the force said the women would have been in their teens at the time and were possibly pupils at a school in chaddesden .
the appeal is part of an investigation into non-recent sex offences .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pair injured in loughborough hit-and-run crash
text: a motorcyclist and his passenger have been injured in a hit-and-run crash in loughborough .
the pair suffered non-life threatening injuries in the collision with a car on allan moss road at about 20:00 yesterday .
the car involved was found abandoned nearby shortly after the incident .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bishop 'shocked ' after couple found dead
text: bishop 'shocked ' after couple found dead

documents.title: weather : mild night ahead
text: there 'll be scattered cloud this afternoon with some sunny spells .
feeling warm with highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
there 'll be variable amounts of cloud tonight with some clear spells .
it 'll be mild with lows of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: leicester stabbing : roads re-open
text: roads in leicester city centre that were shut after a man was stabbed in the early hours have now re-opened .
the victim , a man in his 50s , was found injured at around 12.50am this morning ( wednesday 31 may ) at the junction of sanvey gate and soar lane by a passing police car .
he remains in a critical but stable condition .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman robbed at knifepoint at cash machine
text: a man with a knife grabbed a woman at a cash machine to steal just £ 20 , nottinghamshire police have said .
it happened outside asda in bancroft lane , mansfield , at about 08:50 yesterday morning .
the man approached the woman from behind , put an arm around her while holding a knife in the other hand and demanding the cash she had just withdrawn .
the man , who then ran off onto sutton road , was described as white , about 5ft 7ins tall , aged early to mid-30s , with a pale complexion .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: have you seen missing teenager ?
text: police have appealed for information after a 16-year-old girl went missing from new basford in nottingham yesterday .
natalia bogdan was reported missing at about 12:30 .
she 's around 5ft 4ins tall and was last seen wearing a burgundy hoody with `` new york '' written on it , red skinny jeans and was carrying a large , grey handbag .
natalia , who is polish , is believed to have connections to the west midlands and london area .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : balancing bird in ruddington
text: maggie t uploaded this photo of a rather fancy-looking bird balancing on one leg in ruddington .
browse more weather watcher and submit your own here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: betham leaves leicester for clermont
text: betham leaves leicester for clermont

documents.title: chesterfield one-punch killer jailed
text: a man has been jailed for killing a man with a single punch during a fight in chesterfield town centre .
chris henchcliffe , 26 , died in hospital nine days after suffering head injuries when he was hit by ben edwards in corporation street in july .
edwards , 22 , of fieldview place , chesterfield , denied manslaughter but was found guilty by a jury and sentenced to five-and-a-half years in prison .

det ch insp greg mcgill , who led the investigation , said : `` this case is a tragic example of how one flash of violence can cause such pain , loss and devastation , and should send a stark message about the serious consequences of violence .
chris was just on a night out with friends , and never came home because of that incident .
no argument is worth taking a life for , and as the impact on chris ' family and the sentence that ben edwards has received show , the devastation caused by just one punch can be far-reaching . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: queues for free pizza
text: there 's a huge queue of people waiting for free pizza in nottingham 's old market square .
mod pizza has been handing out whole pizzas to mark its first birthday .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: axe-wielding burglar walks in on girl
text: a burglar carrying an axe ran away after entering a property and finding an 11-year-old girl .
it happened in south clifton , near newark , on saturday afternoon , police said .
the man up the weapon and searched the property in high street but left empty-handed when he discovered the girl in her bedroom .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: milsom signs new notts county contract
text: milsom signs new notts county contract

documents.title: bridge crash causes rail delays
text: rail services between chesterfield and sheffield are currently disrupted because of a vehicle hitting a railway bridge , east midlands trains has said .
the company said a bridge inspector was due to decide shortly whether it was safe for trains to start crossing it again .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new deal for magpies favourite milsom
text: rob milsom - notts county 's player of the season - has signed a new contract at the club .
the 30-year-old midfielder , who joined the magpies from rotherham united in 2015 , up the fans ' player and the players ' player awards at the end of the 2016/17 campaign .
notts chairman alan hardy added : `` it goes without saying that we want to keep our best players here at meadow lane - and rob is certainly one of those . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ice hockey : panthers snap up new goalie
text: nottingham panthers have signed 34-year-old canadian goalie mike garnett .
garnett , who has played in the nhl and the khl , plans to study at loughborough university while playing for the panthers .
head coach corey neilson said : we 've heard nothing but good things about mike .
`` he 's a good fit for us and will be part of our last line of defence alongside eduard and sam .
i 've spoken to him at length and he will do a job for us . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new police chief makes cybercrime top priority
text: cybercrime is one of the biggest issues facing our region , according to the incoming chief constable of derbyshire police .
peter goodman , who takes charge of the force tomorrow , told bbc east midlands today not enough was being done to protect the public .
he said : `` cybercrime and the explosion of criminality through the digital medium is the biggest emerging threat that we face - because of the number of potential victims .
`` we know over 50 % of the victims of crime in this country are victims of crime online rather than offline .
`` there 's more to do and we will do more to make derbyshire a really hostile place for those who seek to exploit the vulnerable . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: taxi driver punched in hospital parking space row
text: a taxi driver suffered a fractured wrist when he was punched in the face by a van driver during a row over a parking space .
the 43-year-old fell to the floor after being assaulted in the outpatient car park at the nuffield hospital in rykneld road in derby on 23 may .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : blue skies are back
text: great to see blue skies have returned .
here 's the scene in loughborough this afternoon , courtesy of scrappy .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: press gather at nottingham court for surgeon sentencing
text: if you 're wondering why there have been such big crowds outside nottingham crown court today
disgraced surgeon ian paterson was jailed for 15 years there today for carrying out unnecesary operations on 10 patients .
he falsely told the nine women and one man in the west midlands they had breast cancer .
the first of many of # ianpaterson victims giving a statement outside court
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : betham leaves tigers for french club
text: french club clermont auvergne have announced the signing of leicester tigers wing peter betham .
the australia international joined tigers in 2015 and only signed a new contract with the club in january .
clermont say they `` seized '' the opportunity to sign betham once they learned he `` could potentially be released '' at welford road .
author: Jason Bourne
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: nhs shake-up planned in derbyshire
text: derbyshire 's clinical commissioning groups ( ccgs ) are proposing to merge in a shake-up of the nhs in the county , according to the health service journal .
there are currently southern derbyshire , hardwick , erewash and north derbyshire ccgs .
they wo n't be saying more about the plans until after the election .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: classic cars stolen in break-in
text: three classic cars were stolen from a house in derbyshire after being loaded onto a flatbed lorry , police have said .
the house , in south normanton , was broken into between 10:00 and 15:00 on may 17 .
police said two men were seen on market street loading the cars onto the lorry .
the cars were a red austin van , a green austin 7 and a lanchester 10 .
documentation for the vehicles was also stolen .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teacher banned for helping gcse pupils too much
text: a worksop teacher has been banned from teaching at any school in england after giving gcse students too much help with their work .

mandy carter , who was head of geography at outwood academy portland , gave one or more students `` help and support beyond what was permitted by the exam board 's guidelines '' , a national college for teaching and leadership panel found .
she also failed to sufficiently record how much time students had spent on their work .
other allegations , including that she let pupils copy each others ' work and added sentences to their assessments , were not proven .
ms carter , 45 , can apply for the prohibition order to be reviewed after five years .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: could football fan be proved right about riyad mahrez ?
text: an arsenal fan who bought a shirt with leicester forward riyad mahrez 's name on the back last summer has said he `` regrets '' getting rid of it .
arsenal season ticket holder asad balal went viral on social media last summer after being with the shirt , but his purchase proved in vain as mahrez stayed with leicester .
but the algerian told leicester on tuesday he wanted to leave the club , sparking fresh speculation he could join arsenal and prove asad was right all along .
`` i do regret getting rid of the shirt to charity , '' mr balal said .
`` i saw the rumours as well and i was thinking you know what , what if it actually happens this year and i get to prove everyone wrong ? ''
mr balal added he would `` 100 % '' get another mahrez shirt should the gunners seal the deal this summer .
the sale of the original shirt raised £ 140 for an animal charity .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : staying summery
text: some cloud will build this afternoon but there 'll still be plenty of bright and sunny weather with light winds and highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: watch : east midlands general election debate highlights
text: did you miss last night 's bbc east midlands general election debate ?

candidates from the five main parties clashed over a number of issues including terrorism , the impact on farming of brexit , the nhs and whether the region was falling behind the northern powerhouse .
nicky morgan for the conservatives said her party would safeguard farmers ' eu subsidies during the two-year brexit negotiations
but barry holliday said the uk 's farmers would be better off staying in the eu and keeping its payments , which the liberal democrats would allow them to do
when the panel were quizzed about the state of the nhs , labour 's chris williamson invoked the spirit of former prime minister clement attlee in an appeal to the audience
pressed about whether the east midlands was falling behind places and regions like the northern powerhouse - kat boettge for the green party claimed a different type of economic plan could help
but has she borrowed a turn of phrase from donald trump ?
meanwhile , ukip 's roger helmer said it was brexit that would ultimately help businesses - by cutting regulations
that was just a selection of highlights from last night 's debate - you can catch up on it in full here .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man appears in court over death of derby woman
text: atual mustafa has appeared at nottingham crown court this morning charged with the murder of a 37-year-old woman in derby .
sobhia tabasim khan , 37 , ( was found dead inside her home in pear tree crescent , normanton , on saturday night .
mr mustafa did n't enter a plea and has been remanded on bail for a further hearing in nottingham in september with a view to a two-week trial in december .
the cause of death has not yet been ascertained .
author: Giles Taylor
BBC East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: 'bitches ' t-shirt 'tame '
text: the news that a group of women kicked off a jet2 flight at east midlands airport for wearing a t-shirt which bore the slogan `` bitches on tour '' has got you talking over on twitter .
`` bitches on tour '' t-shirts `` got women kicked off flight ''
cant understand that seen worst thats tame
`` bitches on tour '' t-shirts `` got women kicked off flight ''
yob stag/hen parties spoil flights for thousands of decent folk .
about time airlines took a hard line with them .
give them 2 yr flight ban
author: Twitter

documents.title: brewers striker facing busy summer
text: burton albion midfielder jackson irvine has been called up to the australia squad for five games over the next two months .
the socceroos are due to face saudi arabia in a world cup qualifier before taking on brazil in a friendly in melbourne .
they then travel to the confederations cup in russia where they will face germany , cameroon and chile in the group stage .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hens removed from plane over offensive tops
text: hens removed from plane over offensive tops

documents.title: stabbed man found by police
text: police have released more information about the stabbing in leicester city centre this morning .
the victim , a man in his 50s , was found by a passing police car at the junction of sanvey gate and soar lane at about 00:50 .
he 's being treated for a single stab wound and remains in a critical but stable condition .
a cordon 's still in place around the scene , on soar lane , frog island and great central street and there is no access to jarvis street .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your views : mahrez set to leave foxes
text: riyad mahrez 's announcement he wants to leave leicester city has received a mixed response on our facebook pages .
paul cann wrote : `` he has done lcfc proud but like any other youngster he is ambitious so good luck and hopefully a suitable replacement can be found . ''
simon lewis said : `` lost my respect from how he 's played all season , he 's already left the club as did n't turn up this year . ''
richard goodger posted : `` mahrez is an overrated player so full of his own hype .
good look on the down turn fool ! ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: man beaten up by group in matlock
text: a man suffered head injuries when he was punched to the ground and kicked by a group while walking home from a night out in matlock .
police said the 38-year-old was attacked by four men as he walked along dale road at about 03:10 on saturday .
he spent a night in hospital before being discharged .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : m1 crash
text: there 's slow traffic and a lane closed on the m1 southbound between junctions 25 and 24 after an accident involving a van and a lorry .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'bitches on tour ' t-shirts 'got women kicked off flight '
text: you might have read yesterday about a group of women who were booted off a jet2 flight for wearing `` offensive t-shirts '' .
a spokesman for the airline said the women refused to cover up the slogan despite being repeatedly warned and were escorted off the flight to majorca at east midlands airport yesterday morning .
the nottingham post is reporting today that the slogan read `` bitches on tour '' .
jet2 said there were families with young children on board but are those words offensive enough to be kicked off a flight ?
let us know your thoughts .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: quad bikers 'sad and pathetic '
text: you 've been reacting on facebook to the shocking cctv footage showing a gang of motorbikers and quad bike riders in nottingham city centre .
edward charter posted : `` it wo n't be long till one of them is seriously injured or killed though completely stupidity driving through red light and on pavements . ''
jasmin barlow-wilkinson wrote : `` they are sad and pathetic doing laps of town scaring people .
they need to get a life ! ! ! ''
dee nadee , however , said there was a deeper issue : `` well maybe if they made somewhere for bikers to enjoy there bikes they wouldnt be doing this on the streets . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: frog island stabbing : forensics officers at scene
text: forensics officers have arrived at the scene of a stabbing in leicester city centre .
several roads have been closed and a large cordon is in place after a man was found seriously injured near frog island at about 01:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: derby gig for boyzone
text: boyzone have announced a gig at derbyshire county cricket club on 16 september .
ronan , shane and the other two will follow in the footsteps of elton john , who 's due to perform there this weekend .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hairdryer trick sends nuisance quad bikers packing
text: after hearing about quad bike riders causing chaos in nottingham city centre , jean from hucknall called bbc radio nottingham to talk about her unusual solution to similar behaviour .
she said : `` i 'm on an estate where during the day they drive you mental - they 're like wasps .
it drives me mad .
`` i 've started to stand at my gate with my hairdryer in my hand - and every time one goes by i lift it up slightly .
everyone slows down - they think you 're holding a speed gun .
`` i have n't seen a bike or anything down here for a couple of weeks . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman 's sock venture named among uk 's most exciting new firms
text: a personalised sock company that was started in a woman 's bedroom in mickleover has been included in a list of the most promising start-up businesses in the uk .
laura dorling , 27 , set up solesmith about 18 months ago after spotting a gap in the market for socks with names on .
it now has a £ 700,000 turnover and has been named on axa business insurance 's annual list of the 100 most promising new firms .
this morning , laura made some socks just for our breakfast presenter ian skye .
author: Heidi Booth
Journalist, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: vandals wreck football ground
text: a football club in thurnby lodge has started a fundraising appeal after vandals smashed up the ground and stole footballs .
thurnby rangers want to raise about £ 2,000 to install cctv and make the ground more secure .
ashley billson , manager of the senior squad , said the youth team had been hit the hardest .
he said : `` all the stuff they got to was the kids ' equipment - the goals , footballs , cones , training equipment .
i think the manager of the youth team has taken it to heart . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'same-sex temple wedding video ' was 'fake news '
text: a hindu temple in leicester has been defending itself after a video was circulated on social media falsely claiming to show a same-sex hindu wedding taking place there .
bosses at shakti mandir in belgrave said they only found out about the video - which was actually filmed in a marquee at a non-religious venue in london - when they started receiving calls about it .
jai purohit , chair of the temple , said the wedding would never have taken place there as it did not hold a licence for same-sex services .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mansfield opera singer wins prestigious award
text: a woman from mansfield has joined the likes of opera greats luciano pavarotti and andrea bocelli in winning a prestigious italian arts award .
carly paoli , who 's a 28-year-old mezzo-soprano , has been presented with the premio barocco .
it recognises achievements in art and culture .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: robins facing winding up order
text: ilkeston football club is facing a day in court after being issued with a winding up order .
but the robins chairman nigel harrop says they 're also `` as close as ever '' to a takeover , which could happen before they appear in court in liverpool on friday .
the club was suspended by the northern premier league in august for what it described as a breach of league rules and regulations .
radio derby sport 's ed dawes said the players have not been paid since december and a number have started looking for a club for next season .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : train delays between stoke-on-trent and derby
text: there are delays to trains between stoke-on-trent and derby this morning due to a broken-down train .
national rail enquiries says the train has been moved , allowing lines to reopen , but adds that delays may continue until midday .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : wednesday 's weather outlook
text: here 's what today has in store
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: police hunt 'wrong way ' quad bikers
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a group of quad bikers and motorcyclists rode `` dangerously and erratically '' in nottingham city centre .
the group was caught on cctv last month doing wheelies , driving the wrong way and weaving in and out of traffic .
a young child without a helmet was seen holding on to the back of one of the riders .
police described the behaviour as `` arrogant '' and `` selfish '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: frog island stabbing closes roads
text: police have closed several roads around frog island in leicester this morning after a man was found with stab wounds in sanvey gate at about 01:00 .
officers at the cordon described the incident to bbc radio leicester as a `` serious stabbing '' .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : latest on east midlands ' roads
text: travel : latest on east midlands ' roads
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live updates
text: hello everyone .
it 's going to be david wade and myself providing today 's news , sport , travel and weather updates for the east midlands on this sunny wednesday .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live
